result.execSummary:
DONALD RAY WOODS was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means DONALD RAY WOODS was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DONALD RAY WOODS

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DONALD RAY WOODS in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant DONALD RAY WOODS in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee has not prepared a waiver of extradition for the court to go over with the defendant.  Atty Hendee states that he has prepared 7 copies for the defendant to sign.  
Court goes over waiver with the defendant and questions the defendant.  Defendant waives his right to extradition.

BY THE COURT:  Court approves the waiver for extradition and signs the waiver.
Defendant signs all 7 copies.

Defendant DONALD RAY WOODS in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant DONALD RAY WOODS in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was taken in on a Warrant from Minnesota.  Atty Hendee filed a fugitive complaint in the matter as the defendant would not waive his rights to extradition. State asks the court to hold the defendant for a period of 30 days at the request of the Governor of Minnesota.  
Court questions the defendant.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that the defendant does not wish to be extradited and requests bail be set.

BY THE COURT:  Action for Governors warrant will be pursued.

Atty Hendee requests that the defendant be held pending that Governor's warrant.  If the Court does not hold the defendant based on the Governor's warrant; the State would request $1,000 cash bond.
Atty Gumz responds and states that the defendant is on supervision from a Portage County case.  Defendant is currently employed.

BY THE COURT:  Bail will be denied.  Defendant will be held pending the Governor's Warrant.

Defendant states that he has no problem waiving extradition.  Atty Gumz states that he apologizes and relied on the information from the jail staff.  Atty Hendee will try to prepare the paperwork and get it back into the court yet today.
BY THE COURT:  Court will recall the case later if the paperwork is done.
